title: Crossing Deltas
caption: delta blues guitar riffs meets glitchy electronic beats, raw slide guitar, deep 808 bass, atmospheric synth pads, gritty and cinematic, male and female duet, harmonizing together
lyrics:
[Verse – Female]
I remember dirt roads and the slow heat rising,
Fields breathing gold under open skies.
You laughed like the day had nowhere to go,
Two kids with nothing but time on our side.
We talked in circles, dreams on our sleeves,
Found a rhythm just walking home.

[Instrumental]
(Warm lift, reflective pause — space for memory and motion)

[Verse – Male]
I remember that moment like it never left,
The way your voice cut through the air.
Same small town, but the world felt wider,
Every step felt lighter with you there.
We didn’t know what forever meant,
But we knew we’d never walk alone.

[Chorus – Both]
We were crossing paths before we knew the name,
Two lines meeting, never drifting away.
From open fields to endless roads,
Every season only made us closer.
Call it chance, call it fate,
Nothing can break what time has made—
We’re still here, still crossing paths.

[Bridge – Both]
If the ground shakes, we stand steady,
If the lights go out, we still see.
Every turn leads back together,
You and me—unchanging, unready to leave.
